description: When the Alert LED is Activated or Inactivated this trap is
generated. The variables provided with it are the current state
of the Alert LED and the alertDescription of the last Activated
Alert LED condition, the name of the managed hub, it's location
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRESLEY-MIB::alertLedTrap PRESLEY-MIB::alertLedState i 1 PRESLEY-MIB::alertDescription s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysContact s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE

description: This Read-only object shows the state of the Alert LED.
variables.name: PRESLEY-MIB::alertLedState

description: The textual identification of the contact person for
this managed node, together with information on how
to contact this person. If no contact information is
known, the value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysContact

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysName

description: The physical location of this node (e.g., 'telephone
closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation
